hero.description: No buzzwords, just code. I solve complex problems with clean architectures and leave behind systems that actually work, not technical debt.

about.title: BUSINESS MEETS TECHNOLOGY
about.text: I don't just write code; I build digital assets. Combining the 'Big Picture' mindset of MIS with modern tech stacks like Supabase & Next.js, I design scalable systems where business logic meets development excellence. No legacy code, just shipping.

analyze.title: Analyze First
analyze.text: I grab a pen before I touch the keyboard. Coding without understanding the problem is just generating bugs.

clean.title: Clean Architecture
clean.text: I respect the next developer. No spaghetti code, just modular, readable, and scalable structures.

optimize.title: Optimization
optimize.text: Working isn't enough; it must fly. I ruthlessly eliminate unnecessary queries and re-renders.

project_desc.vrocks: Vintage aesthetics meets modern tech. Fast, nostalgic, but powerful under the hood.
project_desc.united: A modern web platform for FenerbahÃ§e fans providing event tracking, membership management, and community interaction.

Contact.title: Get in Touch
Contact.description: Feel free to reach out for projects or collaboration.
Contact.message_placeholder: Hi, I'd like to discuss a project with you...

Chatbot.welcome: Hello! I'm 'Terminal', the digital assistant. Type 'help' to start or ask me anything.
Chatbot.fallback: Sorry, command not recognized. Please type 'help' to see available commands.

data.response: Hello! I'm Terminal. YiÄŸit is currently coding. I'm here to answer your questions. Type 'help' to get started.
On the technical side, I invest in Next.js 14, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. My main strength is building clean, readable, and scalable architectures.
Here's the difference: I don't just write code. Thanks to my MIS background, I analyze the business value of every line I write. I merge technical skills with business intelligence.
I study Management Information Systems (MIS) at THK University. This interdisciplinary education allows me to solve problems not just technically, but analytically.
Beyond code: 14 years of scouting, 8 years as a goalkeeper, and I play American Football. Teamplayer to be is for me not a clichÃ©, it's a lifestyle.
You can ask about: 'tech', 'education', 'hobbies', 'why you', or 'contact'.
Shhh. There is a back door in the system. Try the '/secret' path in your browser. But you didn't hear the password from me: 'hell yeah'.

SecretHint.message: ðŸ‘€ Psst! It's quiet here. Try typing 'secret' into the chatbot.

AboutPage.intro: I'm a developer who genuinely enjoys turning complex problems into clean, working solutions. My journey started with curiosity about how things work â€“ and honestly, that curiosity hasn't faded one bit. I studied Management Information Systems, which gave me the superpower of understanding both the code AND the business behind it.

education.title: Where I Learned the Craft
education.desc: THK University taught me that great software isn't just about writing code â€“ it's about understanding why you're writing it. Database design, system analysis, agile workflows... these became my building blocks. But the real education? That happens every day, with every bug I squash and every feature I ship.

vision.title: What I Believe In
vision.clean_code: I write code for the next developer (often future-me). Clean, readable, and maintainable â€“ because nobody likes inheriting a mess.
vision.learning: Tech moves fast, and I love that. There's always a new tool to explore, a better way to solve a problem. That constant learning? It's not a burden, it's the fun part.
